dialogues.text: We got like thirty five trailers here. Long as we've got some that's empty you can stay in one. Sometimes people come in and we got get you a tent or-- fuck, everybody's friendly--- you can always find a bed to crash in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one second.

dialogues.text: Just a second. I have to take care of my baby.

dialogues.text: She's beautiful isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (begging, pleading) Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hazel, entrenched in a crystal methamphetamine psychotic episode, can only gasp in unintelligible spurts.

dialogues.text: Some people come here too far gone. Like Hazel here. The only thing I can do for her is ease her pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hazel rolls her body back and forth on the bed, all the w keeping her head in Uncle Rodney's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hazel) Shhhhh... How about a baby one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Rodney's tenderness in dealing with Hazel calms her He's having way too much fun treating her like a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Rodney takes his pinky and dips it into a small pla bag of powder. He then places it to Hazel's nostril.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quickly snorts the tiny bit off his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hazel) There you go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hazel begins whimpering again.   It wasn't nearly enough satisfy her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something about addiction that brings out something beautiful in a person. Addiction is pure. Addiction reduces a person to an infant. And there's nothing more pure and beautiful in the world than an infant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his finger to Hazel's nostril again, but this tim without any meth on the tip. She snorts with all of her might then starts crying. Uncle Rodney is toying with her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hazel is no longer an adult. She's an infant and I'm the surrogate mother who provides her with much needed breast milk. It's a role that both of us have accepted and embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans over and grabs a syringe, already filled, then gently holds Hazel's arm and expertly injects the liquid her vein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happens for several seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hazel's breathing accelerates. Suddenly she sits up, her eyes go wide. Hazel clinches the bed as if she were ridin roller coaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) That's my girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, she makes eye contact with Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A curious, frightened look comes over her face.   Clearly recognizes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She suddenly JUMPS from the bed and runs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a little jumpy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Rodney smiles, amusing himself with his own joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's begin shall we? And please... I'm going to use this tape for my fans, so let's try to get this right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize if any of this frightens you or makes you uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You won't be fine. What I'm going to teach you will be frightening. The truth is an acquired taste but once you get to it, it's all you'll ever want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Rodney starts in on his mantra.   It's obvious that well versed in his meandering rant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those kids out there... we, the so called "undesirables" - you and me, we know the truth. You know that society doesn't want you, your parents don't want you, corporate America sure as fuck doesn't want you... You wouldn't be here otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNCLE RODNEY (cont'd) If this government had a choice, they'd gas us all in a heartbeat, exterminate us like the Jews, enslave us like niggers, cuz don't kid yourself, WE ARE the new niggers in this country. No one respects us... No one sees what we have to offer... No one has compassion for us.... They don't care, or they're too naive to see that we're a by-product of a wasteful society that has failed to educate, embrace, influence, or inspire any of us. We're societal garbage. The counter culture no longer exists. It's dead... It's been replaced by us--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garbage culture... thrown aside, imprisoned, institutionalized, systematically abused, executed, and enlisted into wars started by government ass- fuckers just to kill us off. JUST TO KILL US OFF. And every week one of you shows up here, disillusioned, addicted, angry, pissed 'cuz they tossed you aside... into the garbage. Every time someone like you shows up here the garbage culture gets a little bit stronger and they get a little bit weaker. Until the "them" and the "they" of this country run out of places to put us, to put its garbage, and the garbage OVER-FLOWS into their cities from out of the confines of the spaces that they have set aside for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (biblical) And we will SET FIRE to their world! And we will burn it, until a living HELL REIGNS over what was their former world, and we will fornicate in their ashes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodney stops, almost out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what's here for you.   That's what's here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodney settles himself down and takes a few deep breaths Jimmy begins zooming out. Uncle Rodney lights a cigarette calm himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy keeps filming, not knowing whether Rodney is finish or just taking a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera shuts down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone (Buddy) is filming a raging party consisting of a of strung out young white trash junkies just like the one Jimmy was interviewing before. It's certainly a weird bun They all look alike, dress similar, and have the same typ crystal methamphetamine induced facial expressions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of them are smoking weed and drinking forty ounce be while dancing around a campfire and playing the bongo dru They all seem to be having more fun than anyone should be allowed.

dialogues.text: Camera pans to Jimmy, so we realize that he's not filming Our best guess would be that it's Buddy who's filming. Ji screams at the camera over the noise of the Bongo drums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Judy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy's hand comes into frame as he points by the fire pi We now see Jimmy see Judy.

dialogues.text: She dances fervently drinking a forty surrounded by tons other drunk, happily intoxicated teenagers. Say what you might about the attendees to the event, this party is a FUCKING RAGER and Judy is happy to be the center of everyone's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone dances faster and faster as the rhythm of drums faster and become more intense. It's an all out jam sessi

dialogues.text: Jimmy heads to the center of the circle of people dancing around Judy. Camera follows him with a zoom as he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows how much later. Minutes or hours, the party rag forward. The camera spins around. The party has reached a new level of drunken absurdity. Most of those who are dancing are drunk, stoned or both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, while it's too dark and hectic see anything explicit, some of the teenagers are engaged in a variety of sexual activity. Some have threesomes. Some ar probably having oral sex. Still others dance around them the foreground.

dialogues.text: Camera zooms in on Uncle Rodney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing just behind him, we see of flash of someone recognizable. It's a skinny woman, she looks vaguely familiar, but it's hard to get a fix with all the crazine going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns her head to look over at Rodney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we can clearly see that this person is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAZEL - with her eyes wide and clearly in the height of rolling on crank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Bodies wipe the frame.

dialogues.text: Moments later. Camera catches Judy who hasn't missed a st along the way to being a high, drunken mess. The rhythm o the drum beats is ever present.

dialogues.text: Jimmy doesn't notice, but there are about four or five of kids, especially a couple of Rodney's Bigger Guys standin not too far behind Uncle Rodney watching the conversation intensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really difficult to put your finger on it exactly, b something doesn't seem right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Rodney lets go of Judy and puts his arm around Jimm With the noise of the drums and the fact that we're zoome from a distance, we can't hear anything they're saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Uncle Rodney and Jimmy are having a conversation as t move towards the camera. Though Jimmy can't see it, we ca see that Rodney's Bigger Guys, the ones that were standin behind Uncle Rodney are now pushing Judy along behind Jim and Rodney. Though Uncle Rodney seems to be having a very light and friendly conversation with Jimmy, we continue t get the feeling that something ominous is afoot.

dialogues.text: Finally, they approach camera and we can hear them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you guys came down here. We never would have guessed you'd come and see us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been awesome.   Judy loves it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Rodney's got Jimmy in an incredibly friendly one ar side hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew she would. By the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodney's face drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you did to Dinko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hits Jimmy like a lead weight. Before he can react a all, and before he realizes that anything is happening, J is suddenly thrown into a headlock by Uncle Rodney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off camera, something similar is happening to Judy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) What the fuck are you doing?! Jimmy, Jimmy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy!   Jimmy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Shut it, bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMACK!   Judy's been hit by Buddy off screen.

dialogues.text: Camera shuts down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear intense struggling and laughter. By the sounds we hear, we gather that Jimmy and Judy are being dragged off into the woods against their will by Buddy and Rodney's Bigger Guys, but it's too dark to tell if that is what in fact is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone unidentified is running the show and operates the camera. It's impossible to see, but it's definitely Buddy voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, here, here. Right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy?

dialogues.text: (screams) Please somebody help us!

dialogues.text: Jimmy grunts, trying to break free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, asshole! You wanna fucking talk!

dialogues.text: (defiant) Fuck you!

dialogues.text: Jimmy gets kicked again just once. Then suddenly, a barra of kicks come at Jimmy one after the other after the othe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: With one last kick, the camera is knocked aside and we do see Jimmy's face anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he fucking dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy!   Jimmy say something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They mock her in a high pitched wining voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking) Jimmy. Jimmy say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her clothes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Noooooo! Noooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy screams at the top of her lungs over and over again we hear them tearing at her clothes. Then they pick her u and start pulling her away from camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extremely faint) Jimmy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally there's silence. The camera isn't moving.    It's the ground and in the dark. Camera shuts down.

dialogues.text: It's completely pitch black dark. We can see nothing. can only hear the sound of Jimmy fumbling around and breathing heavily and nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, we see everything, albeit in a weird black and white grainy fashion. Jimmy's flipped the camera into Nit Shot, using the fuzzy black and white mode as a tool to s in the complete darkness. He's strapped the camera to his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image is Jimmy's POV as he searches through his trunk something. Pulling aside a duffle bag, we see the 9mm pis that Jimmy stole from the Cop. He grabs it as camera shut down.

dialogues.text: By the fire pit, the site where the teenage drunken of or took place, the bonfire has been put out and there are do of drunken/passed out teenagers lying on the ground in sleeping bags and in tents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a girl lying on the ground in a sleeping bag   wi back turned to the camera. Her hair is identical to    Ju but we can't see her face. Jimmy quietly steps over    pa out teenagers, being extremely careful not to awaken   an

dialogues.text: Jimmy accidently kicks a forty ounce beer bottle that cau a loud clanking sound of glass on glass.

dialogues.text: Jimmy stops in his tracks in anticipation of someone waki up. No one does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy continues to walk towards the GIRL WHO LOOKS LIKE J

dialogues.text: Kneeling directly in front of her, Jimmy puts his hands o her shoulder and pulls the girl's front region towards th camera. The girl flips over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not Judy. And luckily, the girl is so severely intoxicated that she doesn't wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy now makes his way over to a tent. He quietly unzips the mesh entrance and extends his arm out to video tape t inside. Turns out, the person in the tent is just another passed out flunky loser. Jimmy quickly takes his arm out the tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy gives it one last go and continues to look for Judy among the sea of passed out bodies lying on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy's not too far from Uncle Rodney's trailer.   He dec to make his way up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks, using his Nite Shot to see, through the sea of bodies until he gets up to the entrance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a cracked glass door leaning up against the woodp by the entrance. Jimmy steps around it, turning the lens the glass. He briefly catches his reflection. He looks li hell warmed over, freshly bruised and cut from the recent beating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving forward, Jimmy makes it to the front door of Uncle Rodney's trailer. We hear music coming from inside. Very slowly and very carefully, Jimmy cracks the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's even darker inside of the trailer, but Jimmy presses forward in spite of that fact, still using his Nite Shot see. A boom box sits by the bed, still on, playing music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy is scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corner of the room, in a make shift bunk, is Uncle Rodney sleeping with his arms wrapped around a girl in a spooning position. There's no doubt this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's definitely JUDY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are both sound asleep and actually look very cozy ly together. Jimmy slowly walks over towards them. Each step is slower and slower, being extra careful not to wake the

dialogues.text: Once Jimmy is within arm's length of the two of them he stops. He hesitates for a moment. He hasn't prepared himself for this particular situation and doesn't know exactly what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues filming them until he finally musters the courage to extend his non-filming arm out to tap Judy on face. Judy remains unconscious/sleeping as Jimmy gently t the side of her cheek. Jimmy slowly begins tapping harder and harder until the tap evolves into a poke. Still nothi

dialogues.text: THWACK! An arm comes out of nowhere and grabs Jimmy's pok hand. Jimmy has woken up Uncle Rodney!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck...!

dialogues.text: Intense and furious wrestling ensues as Uncle Rodney flie out of frame then, in a split second:

dialogues.text: A gunshot goes off. We hear a Uncle Rodney collapse, followed by more gun shots. The camera has fallen from Jimmy's hand and dangles by the wrist strap. Camera comes rest on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy's shot and killed him.

dialogues.text: Outside, footsteps hit the deck.    Buddy opens the door trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.text: Three more rounds are fired, hitting Buddy square in the chest, knocking him down. Jimmy points the camera at a de Buddy on his back then whip pans it back to Judy in the b Finally we hear Jimmy speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside we hear voices of some of Rodney's Other Teens.

dialogues.text: Jimmy acts fast. Judy has been drugged and is mostly unconscious and groggy, but Jimmy picks her up and gets h on her feet, shouldering her out the door. Shot continues to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faint) Hey! Hey!

dialogues.text: A DISTANT GUNSHOT FIRES, but we can't see what is going o It's too dark and the camera is too shaky as they go to..

dialogues.text: Another DISTANT SHOT, then Jimmy gasps in pain. He's been shot, but decides to run, trying to carry a groggy Judy anyway. Their car is in sight as we hear guns going off a bullets whizzing by them. One hits Dinko's car.

dialogues.text: We see him scramble to get the key in the ignition as we a BULLET HIT the driver's door. The car starts, and Jimmy throws it into gear, flooring the gas as he speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy?   Judy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy's voice begins to crack as he talks to/tries to wak Judy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right baby?   Please wake up Judy. Judy?

dialogues.text: Close on Judy. The afternoon light strikes a shadow acros her face. Her hair's a mess. No makeup.

dialogues.text: Judy, sweetie. Come on honey.      I saw you waking up.

dialogues.text: There ya go.

dialogues.text: Judy opens her eyes.    She smiles when she sees Jimmy be the lens.

dialogues.text: Am I with you?

dialogues.text: Mexicooooooh....

dialogues.text: Judy points the camera up at Jimmy. This is the first tim we've seen him at all since he was beaten up by Uncle Rodney's group. He's a wreck. His face is puffy. His lip is cut up. His eye is swollen. He looks like a flyweight boxer who just went fifteen rounds with a heavyweight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drives with one arm because the other one is in a band

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy looks like a beaten man, both physically and emotionally. His bad ass attitude and rebellious charisma are seemingly non-existent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time, we are seeing Jimmy without his armor He looks like any other 21 year old kid who is down, vulnerable, and confused. Not to mention the fact that he has a fucking bullet lodged in his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.     Not the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooo. It reminds me of when we first met. Just you, me, and the camera. God, do you remember how you used to freak me out?

dialogues.text: Yeah, those were the good old days. How much money do we have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel about Canada?   It's closer.

dialogues.text: Are we going together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy looks over at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I should take you home.

dialogues.text: Judy doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could write you a letter. Or I could make a video saying I made you do everything. They'd believe you. You could tell them it was all my fault. You could tell them I was going to Mexico and I'd really go to Canada.

dialogues.text: Jimmy swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We swore on the bond we'd never be apart... but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIMMY (cont'd) I'll let you out of it... If you want to be out of it, I'll let you out.

dialogues.text: You're never leaving me, and I'm never leaving you. That's all there is to it.

dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.text: Judy leans in and kisses him.

dialogues.text: Owww.

dialogues.text: Jimmy?

dialogues.text: You wanted to ask me something?

dialogues.text: You know I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I love you, right?

dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.text: Judy?

dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.text: We're fucked.

dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.text: Judy looks up immediately.    Her face drops.

dialogues.text: Jimmy flips the camera around out the back window. There' Ohio State Trooper with its lights flashing tailing them. lone trooper is on his radio.

dialogues.text: That's it baby. We're done.

dialogues.text: Judy doesn't answer.    She's short circuited.

dialogues.text: Just pull over. It's not worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy, what are you doing?      You know this is...

dialogues.text: Judy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy looks straight ahead, determination on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't answer.    Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns the wheel hard to the right, almost carrying Ji into her, and takes the car onto a side road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy is on her own mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car stops short. Jimmy turns the camera to point out windshield. They're stuck. The road has come to a dead en

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy ignores Jimmy. She throws the car into reverse and tries to turn it around and head back the way she came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A faint sound of a helicopter fades up slowly from the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy doesn't respond.    She's determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, it's over. I'll do what I said before. I'll tell them I made you do it. It'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I want us to be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) Well we fucking can't, so pull the fuck over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we can. I won't give you up. I won't let you go. No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy pans the camera out the front windshield. In the distance, we catch sight of a road block that's been set at the end of the dirt trail. They're screwed. There's nowhere to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She still doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the car thrusts itself forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy!     Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy's got a look of determination in her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy doesn't respond. O.C., she's murmuring something to herself that Jimmy can't hear or understand while she has throttle to the floor as they barrel toward the roadblock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy keeps going.    Jimmy flips the back camera towards

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy!     Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy's murmurs grow louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy braces himself as the car continues toward the roadblock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Judy's murmurs get loud enough or us to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmurs) We'll be together. We'll be together. We'll be together. We'll be together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head straight in between two cars that form the roadblock. Cops jump out of the way as the car hits head into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impact sends the camera flying against the windshield, CRACKING IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds of metal twisting and glass shattering is all encompassing as the camera shakes in a violent frenzy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera settles on Judy's face, bloody, unconscious agains the steering wheel, her neck snapped, eyes open in a deat stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera stays focussed on Judy for the longest time as she leans against the steering wheel. Music plays on the radi It's JOHNNY CASH's cover of Tom Petty's "I won't Back Dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERHEAD SHOT of a news helicopter flying above the final scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down from above, we see what the helicopter sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scene of about twelve State Trooper cars, lights flashi with Jimmy and Judy's car wrecked. Ambulances are there. Jimmy and Judy's lifeless bodies are pulled from their ca Johnny Cash's song shifts from background to score.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter continues its circular pattern as the song continues and we...
